lifeFormTypes

Class ACarnivore

  • java.lang.Object
    • artificialLifeSimulator.AWorldObject
      • worldObjects.ALifeForm
        • lifeFormTypes.ACarnivore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ACarnivore
extends ALifeForm
    A type of LifeForm which will only eat herbivores within it's world.
    Author:
    Jed Brennen
    See Also:
    ALifeForm, AWorldObject, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ACarnivore

        public ACarnivore(AWorld world,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  int energy,
                  int id)
        A type of LifeForm which will only eat herbivores within it's world.
        Parameters:
        world - - the world in which the carnivore is placed.
        name - - the name of the carnivore.
        energy - - the initial energy of the carnivore.
        id - - the id number of the carnivore.

    • Method Detail

      • sense

        public Direction sense()
        Description copied from class: ALifeForm
        Senses the type of food eaten by the particular life form by searching horizontally and vertically on the x and y axis' over the range of the LifeForm's senseDistance. The method will look for the food with the greatest value and return the direction of the food. If no food is found this method will return a randomly selected direction.
        Specified by:
        sense in class ALifeForm
        Returns:
        - Direction of food with greatest value or random direction.
        See Also:
        Direction

      • move

        public AWorldObject move(Direction d)
        Description copied from class: ALifeForm
        This method moves the LifeForm 1 space in the specified direction. It will return whatever world object previously occupied the space when the LifeForm moved. If the space to which the LifeForm moved is empty the method will return null. The method will also return null if the LifeForm is unable to move due to obstruction.
        Specified by:
        move in class ALifeForm
        Parameters:
        d - - the direction in which to move.
        Returns:
        the world object in the square which has been moved to.
